DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim study develop interactive Internet-based program ( WeBREATHe : Web-Based Respiratory Education About Tobacco Health ) train pediatric respiratory therapist nurse provide brief , hospital-based tobacco cessation intervention parent pediatric patient . The WeBREATHe program base Phase I prototype evaluate 50 pediatric respiratory therapist nurse . In Phase II , investigator redesign expanded program input 50 educator , nurse respiratory therapist Cincinnati Children 's Hospital Medical Center . Then investigator evaluate Phase II program randomize trial 215 respiratory therapist nurse two large , urban child 's hospital randomly assign within hospital either Intervention ( Training ) Condition , Delayed Treatment ( Training ) Control condition . Participants ' demographic tobacco use history measure baseline , tobacco cessation intervention behavior , attitude , knowledge , perceive barrier , self-efficacy regard delivery tobacco cessation intervention measure baseline , 1 week post-training , 3 month post-training . User satisfaction measure also collect 1 week post-training Intervention Condition participant . The investigator hypothesize participant Intervention Condition would increase tobacco cessation behavior , positive attitude self-efficacy , decrease perceive barrier participant Delayed-Treatment Control Condition . Following evaluation , investigator develop final version interactive training program create administrative infrastructure marketable product .
DOC.brief_title: Web-Based Respiratory Education About Tobacco Health Phase II
DOC.criteria: Must respiratory Therapist , nurse nurse practitioner 2 pediatric hospital participate study . Must least 18 year age . Under 18 year age .
